subject: Request for Assistance with Image Positioning in Product Specifications Accordion

full_threads.body: Hey kuya @joel - can input the time here, thank you!

Hi Samir,

I hope you are doing well.

Noted on this one. We were digging for the code that is causing this issue.

Have a great weekend!

Hi Team,

Please ignore this request.

"Currently, if the product variation (e.g., size) is not selected and the quantity is increased, it causes a pricing error."

Kind Regards,

Samir Bhatta IT Support | Bachelors of IT |

Proudly Supporting

Sure, I'll get back to you on this. In the meantime, could you please help me resolve an issue? Currently, if the product variation (e.g., size) is not selected and the quantity is increased, it causes a pricing error.
Would it be possible to add a pop-up message prompting the user to select a variation to see the price? This will minimise the confusion for our customers.
https://www.designtiles.com.au/product/micro-cement-white-textured-porcelain-tile/

Hi Samir,

Yes, that’s correct, but just a quick heads-up: we ran into an issue with the accordion when the trigger was opened, which is why we had to turn it off.
The workaround here would be to implement a custom code solution.

Let me know what you think?

Hi Joel,

Thanks for your email. I remember you had once disabled this accordion. Is it possible to re-enable it?

Kind Regards,

Hi Samir,

I hope you're doing well.

We've done a quick review, and it looks like this task may take approximately 2 hours. This is due to the need for custom coding to ensure compatibility with elements on the single page.

Please let me know if you'd like us to proceed.

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Rica Rosario Valencia

full_threads.body:
Hi Team,

Could you please assist me in implementing a feature where the images move down as the user scrolls through the product specifications (accordion), so that the images continue to fill the available space?
https://www.designtiles.com.au/product/clovelly-white-subway-wall-tile/

Kind Regards,
